meanings.definition: Work done remotely using telecommunications technology.
meanings.sent1: Teleworking allows employees to work from home using computers and phones.
meanings.sent2: Many companies now offer teleworking options to their staff for increased flexibility.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried teleworking by sitting on the keyboard, but it didn't get any work done.
meanings.sent4: In the world of teleworking, the office is wherever the Wi-Fi connects.
meanings.sent5: Teleworking became the new norm during the pandemic, changing the way we work forever.

meanings.definition: The act of working from a location other than a traditional office.
meanings.sent1: Teleworking has become popular as people seek a better work-life balance.
meanings.sent2: Some employees find teleworking more productive than commuting to an office.
meanings.sent3: The penguin decided to try teleworking from the zoo instead of the icy Antarctic.
meanings.sent4: For her, teleworking was like exploring a new frontier of work possibilities.
meanings.sent5: Teleworking offers a sense of freedom and independence to many workers.
